titleStmt.title: Letter December 25, 256
titleStmt.author: Apollonios, dioiketes, 12 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p.292-293

msContents.summary: Letter of Apollonios to Zenon: he is sending Midas to take care of the mules and Midas should receive his wages, clothing allowance, and food allowance

msItemStruct.note: Written across the fibers with 7 lines; the back is written along the fibers
On the back there is the address, the docket, and a note by the first scribe indicating the subject, written upside down
Plate in P.Col. III facing p. 80
Written in the large chancery hand of Apollonios' office, but with unusual cancellations and additions

div.ab: Apollonios to Zenon, greeting. I have sent Midas, the muleteer, to you. Make use of him, therefore, in connection with the mules and order him to take over the care of them. Give him the fixed wages and food allowance punctually. For he has obtained his clothing allowance from me and has received his wages UP to the month Dios. Good-by. Year 30, Dios 11, Hathyr 1. [Verso:j Year 30, Dios 23, Hathyr 23. [Scribe's notation:] Regarding Midas. On wages of Midas, muleteer. To Zenon.
